column5: Nice bucket there CC! I too find it a bit weird that you're holding a bass in a tshirt

The first time I met Scott on the tribs, he was telling me that before he got right into steelheading that he focussed mainly on bass.  It looks like he's come full circle, using his experiences on the tribs and tips from more knowledgeable folks like yourself to excel at another species.  I have a feeling he's counting his pennies right now trying to figure out how to get himself a bass boat....LOL.
Excellent bass Scotty!!   Props to Mark!

Thats how it worked for me ccmt I fished bass, then a lot of downrigging for salmon, steelheading the spring winter fall, ocasional bass, pike,musky walleye, I got into touneys by accident , my buddys former partner won 649 -went downhill real fast-I volunteered,that was 8 yrs. ago, and the rest is history, it is a real learning curve I do have to say, but Scotts doing it the way he should-get info and apply it the only real place it counts-on the water!

BEEN IN SEARCH FOR A BIG BOY FOR AWHILE NOW ON THE SCUGOG AND FINALLY GOT 1. FIRST OFF I'D LIKE TO THANK MARK KULIK. MARK JUST SENT ME AN EMAIL GAVE ME HIS NUMBER AND 45 MINS OF HIS TIME ON THE PHONE LAST NIGHT. I TOOK SOME OF MARKS ADVICE OFF THE PHONE AND PUT IT ON THE WATER TODAY AND BAM I GOT RESULTS!!! SO WITH HIS ARM INJURY AND CANT FISH I WANNA THANK MARK CAUSE IF IT WASNT FOR HIS INFO I WOULD NEVER OF CAUGHT THIS!!! THIS ONES FOR YOU BUD!! 5.1 ON THE SCALE
AWESOME,JUST AWESOME. Nice feeling aint it? CONGRATS CC.
Nice Pig CC  Gets the blood flowinn eh  Cheers  Craig
Nice Pig! Scugog has some very big bass in it.
That's a real nice Green Trout you got there!!!
nice big bucket!  Cheers!
Good going!
Nice one CC. I still find it strange to see you with anything other than a trout. I hope to get good one tomorrow, we'll see.
Congrats on a real beauty and kudo's to Mark - heard nothing but good things about the man.
Good going CC, that is a beaut for sure  Joey
Wow, nice size! Did it put up a fight?

Great Job. This board still amazes me. How people connect on this board and offer help, its great to see.  Nice fish. Now if anyone wants to help me out with some GBay Musky, PM me as I am constantly hitting 0 on Georgian Bay with the Musky.  Anyways, Great job and I am glad Mark helped you out and you got results.
Congratulation CC    She's a real hog  Thanks for sharing Leechman

Hey Scott.......WTG big Guy...WTG. ...your dead right about Mark too......more then willing to give of his time.  (Mark,..How the hell is your arm doing????? .....you'll be getting a telephone call from myself later today as discussed) ...Stoney's comming soon Bud! - pete
WTG Scott buddy....Not to worry though bud ,the first is always the toughest....TC and tight lines.....Chuck.....
Nice fish for sure..wtg
great job neat pic
Nice fish! I`ve had a few fish around 5lbs over the years on Scugog. Were you fishing up near the river.
TX ALL!!! HUGE DIFFERENCE IN THE FIGHT FROM 3 TO 5 LBS  LOL AMAZING STRENGTH!! HAD MY HEAVY ACTION ST.CROIX BENT RIGHT OVER!!! CP GUY YA JUST AT THE MOUTH!!!
It's a beaut for sure, good work CC...

Nice fish Scott! makes me feel good ! glad to help, it makes me feel usefull LOL, I have always enjoyed pics and stoties of fishing adventures , I get my flex-cast this wed, so I hope to be able to get the kids out, maybe you can give me a hand BRIAN, and give me a call Peter, if I can't be fishing I at least like to talk fishing!-good job again Scott -now go out and get a six!
way to go! Nice looking pig!
Whoa!!! Nice fish CC!  Congrats on the PB 5 pounder.  It's still strange seeing pics of you with Bass though....LOL

Bob Izumi told me that some of the best steelheaders become successful bass anglers, I think it's about feel and attention to detail, sure takes some time on the lake to figuire out a new specie , so-Scotts hooked, just a matter of time before I see him beside me in his new bass-boat at blast-off!
Nice bucket!  You'll be hooked on them for sure!
